question: How do I check which services failed to start?

golden_answer.summary: Use 'systemctl --failed' to list all failed units, then 'systemctl status <service>' and 'journalctl -u <service>' for details.
steps: Or list only failed services: systemctl --state=failed
Check specific service status: systemctl status <service-name>
View logs since last boot: journalctl -u <service-name> -b
Reset failed state after fixing: sudo systemctl reset-failed <service-name>
validation: systemctl --failed shows no output if all services OK
warnings: Some failed services may be expected (like systemd-networkd if you use NetworkManager)
Check logs to understand why service failed before trying to restart
Failed services don't automatically retry - must be manually started after fixing
